poem:
**Amidst the Crisis**

bold strokes carve
homes from the promise
of these hands, 
brick by brick—
the people's flesh,
the congresswoman's dream
  
in the shadow
of broken beginnings, 
new rooms rise—
a nation's breath,
a shelter
in our storms

With Tina Smith, a Democratic senator for Minnesota, Ocasio-Cortez has introduced the Homes Act in the House of Representatives to address what they call a “housing crisis” that has left millions". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
